Name: enzymes production | enzymes | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: This activity represents the production of 1 kg of enzymes. In this activity we assume enzymes are produced from potato starch along with a bacterial strain. The bacterial strain is ommited leaving the enzyme production based only on potato starch as input. It is assumed that 4.16 kg of potato starch are needed to produce 1 kg of enzymes (Lages and Tannenbaum 2006). Heat and electricity required for the production are taken as the average of the values reported in Dunn et al. (2012) as inputs for the production of the following three enxymes: Alpha-amylase; Glucoamylase; Cellulase.;Reference(s): ;Dunn et al. 2012. Energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions from enzyme and yeast manufacture for corn and cellulosic ethanol production. Biotechnol Lett. DOI 10.1007/s10529-012-1057-6. ;Ana C. A. Lages, Steven R. Tannenbaum, 2006, Production of Glucose from Tapioca (Cassava Starch) and Farinha de Mandioca (Cassava Meal). Journal of Food Science, DOI: 10.1111/j.1365-2621.1978.tb02474.x;For more information on the model please refer to the dedicate ecoinvent report, access it in the Report section of ecoQuery (http://www.ecoinvent.org/login-databases.html)
